intro: Machaonia havanensis, commonly known as the Cuban mahogany, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the island of Cuba and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its bark is thick and often has a reddish hue, while its wood is highly valued for its durability and fine grain. Machaonia havanensis plays an important role in the ecosystems of its native habitat and is also appreciated for its ornamental value.
